Row.Text: {1_Playername} discovered an arms smuggling operation!
{1_Playername} raided an arms shipment of [ICON_RES_IRON] Iron passing through their territory. In other news, a fire has left dozens dead at a recent political summet.
{1_Playername} recruits financial experts from a City State!
{1_Playername} has secured backing from a well placed political faction.
{1_Playername} moves againt organised-crime syndicates.
Rumours suggest that {1_Playername} has more knowledge about goings on within their Empire than first thought!
{1_Playername} displays heightened levels of military intelligence.
Rumours suggest that {1_Playername} has more knowledge about other Empires' military movements than they should!
War Materials

Our agents have estabilished comprehensive links within a dissident City-State faction. They have leaked us intelligence of an arms smuggling operation occuring in our territory at this very moment![NEWLINE][NEWLINE]How should we act on this?
Gain +2 [ICON_RES_IRON] Iron and {2_InstantYield}.
Gain an Envoy in each city.
Your Chanceries increase [ICON_GOLD] Gold production in cities by 5%.
Your eligible Military Units gain the Ambush I promotion.
Sieze the shipment when it reaches the border. We cannot guarantee anyone's safety at such short notice.
Our contacts must be desperate. Under the guise of recruiting financial experts, send our Foreign Advisor to negotiate for their remaining political links.
Small arms deals do not interest me. However, the extent of this infiltration is astouding. Exfiltrate these agents and give them their own agency. Let's call it CI:5.
Small arms deals do not interest me. However, the field skills detailed in this report are second to none. Exfiltrate these agents and send them to the new military intelligence branch, CI:6.
{1_Playername} extends hand to foreign dissidents.
{1_Playername} gains additional cultural and diplomatic influence.
Rumours circulate that {1_Playername} is funding terrorist organisations!
Autocracy and Order Empires are now vulnerable to partisan attacks on their Occupied Cities.
Alliance of the Free

Your recent backing of Covert Operations has led to several competing teams within CI:7. Each has a different idea of how the additional funding should be spent.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]What is your verdict?
Gain +4 [ICON_RES_PAPER] Paper. Airports increase [ICON_CULTURE] Culture output in cities by 5%.
The [ICON_OCCUPIED] Occupied Cities of other Ideologies are vulnerable to partisan attacks.
Reduce the [ICON_GOLD] Poverty and [ICON_RESEARCH] Illiteracy thresholds in all cities by 15%.
I like Operation Golden Door. We will defeat our enemies with the strength of our conviction and purity of our ideology.
I like Operation Pincushion. We will give those who yearn for Freedom the weapons with which to do so.
I like Operation Illuminatus. Sometimes, to remain free, we must do things against our own moral code. The happy populus, not burdened as we who must lead, cannot be allowed to naively interfere.
A rebel uprising has ignited in the City of {2_CityName}.
Two [ICON_WAR] Barbarian units have spawned near {2_CityName}.
Partisan Uprising
Surprisingly well-armed dissidents have to the streets of our City, protesting the Occupation. Those filthy Capitalists are behind this, mark my words.

Surprisingly well-armed dissidents have to the streets of our City, protesting the Occupation. Those filthy Capitalists are behind this, mark my words.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Two [ICON_WAR] Barbarian units spawn.
A rebel uprising has ignited in the City of {2_CityName}.
Two [ICON_WAR] Barbarian units have spawned near {2_CityName}.
Partisan Uprising
Surprisingly well-armed dissidents have to the streets of our City. Those filthy Capitalists are behind this, mark my words.

Surprisingly well-armed dissidents have to the streets of our City, protesting the Occupation. Those filthy Capitalists are behind this, mark my words.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Two [ICON_WAR] Barbarian units spawn.
{1_Playername} has abducted a foreign citizen.
{1_Playername} gained a [ICON_GREAT_PEOPLE] Great Person.
They Know We Know They Know...
An agent we planted in a foreign intelligence agency believes she is being fed false information.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]How should we instruct her to continue?
Gain the Covert Action Policy for {4_Turns}.
Wire Service increase [ICON_RESEARCH] Science in Cities by 10%.
Lose 500 [ICON_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Age points in exchange for a Great Person.
Let them doctor their schematics; meanwhile we will put more people inside their Covert Action scheme.
Bug everything. We need to know what they are up to at all times!
We can't risk corrupted information. The next high profile target our asset gets near is coming back with her to the Motherland.
Art Forgery

New, 'non-destructive' analysis is all the rage in our galleries. Unfortunately, our Cultural Advisor believes at least one of our paintings is, in fact, a fake.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]They are going to find out...
Spend {2_InstantYield} to gain the same amount of [ICON_GREAT_ARTIST] Great Artist points.
Lose {2_InstantYield} Culture.
Gain a copy of the [ICON_RES_GLASS] Glass resource.
We must protect the reputation of our Artists. Pay off whoever you need to.
Oh well. Isn't all Art a lie?
Fortunately, a City State Museum has been after that painting for ages. Tell them they can have it for that one stained-glass statue I like.
